item.title: 3.5mm jack sockets
item.description: Mono jacks with switching contact With wire lugs LCSC XKB Connectivity PJ-301M-2-B Part #: PJ-301M-2-B LCSC Part #: C381126 Shenzhen Kinghelm Elec KH-PJ-301M Part #: KH-PJ-301M LCSC Part #: C5123127 Reichelt CLIFF FC6812 JYO-35 Part #: FC6812 JYO-35 LUMBERG 1502-03 Part #: 1502 03 this one is a bit different to the others Tayda 3.

item.title: ADSR(-ish) envelope generator
item.description: This is a simple but effective envelope generator designed by Moritz Klein in his video. It approximates an ADSR by mixing together a short +12V peak and an attenuated version of the input signal and then feeding them into a capacitor through 2 diodes and potentiomters.

item.title: Baby-8 CV Sequencer
item.description: The Baby-8 is a really simple and effective step sequencer built out of a CD4017(up to 10 steps) or CD4022(up to 8 steps) counter chip.

item.title: Bake your own vactrols !
item.description: An optocoupler allows signal transmition between two isolated circuits with two parts: an LED that emits infrared light and a photosensitive device (LDR) which detects light from the LED.

item.title: Contributing content from your browser
item.description: First you need to create a GitHub account, log in and navigate to our GitHub repository

item.title: CV Input to Microcontroller
item.description: Many digital modules will need at least one CV input, however you have likely noticed that while Eurorack can have ±12V travelling through its patch cables, most microcontrollers will be very unhappy to receive anything outside of the range 0-3.

item.title: Digital Input to Microcontroller
item.description: Most microcontrollers run on either 3.3V or 5V logic, whereas Eurorack gates and triggers are usually between 5-8V.

item.title: MS-20 Filter
item.description: The MS-20 is a synthesizer made by Korg and it has a pretty nice sounding filter. René Schmitz has made a popular clone of it and has schematics avavailable on his site.

item.title: Operational transconductance amplifiers
item.description: Texas instruments has discontinued the DIP-16 version of the LM13700 so they are getting harder to buy.

item.title: Power cables
item.description: Connectors 10-pin LCSC BOOMELE(Boom Precision Elec) C20343 Part #: C20343 BOOMELE(Boom Precision Elec) C8373 Part #: C8373 Nextron(Nextronics Engineering) Z-81010100124000 Part #: Z-81010100124000 LCSC Part #: C110601 grey JILN 531410YBS0BW01 Part #: 531410YBS0BW01 LCSC Part #: C601911 16-pin LCSC BOOMELE(Boom Precision Elec) C8372 Part #: C8372 JILN 531416YBS0BW02 Part #: 531416YBS0BW02 LCSC Part #: C601927 Wire Old 40-pin IDE cables are a great source for the ribbon wire used in eurorack power cables and you can get them used for very cheap or even free.

item.title: Repository structure and article formatting
item.description: All the content in the wiki lives in the /content folder of the repository and consists of pages written in markdown with a little bit of extra metadata.
